Sentence: Julian was engaged to Edith Bartlett, a beautiful, graceful Boston aristocrat
Meanwhile, Julian learns that Doctor Leete's daughter, Edith is the great-granddaughter of Edith Bartlett
Julian and Edith become engaged, much to Doctor Leete's pleasure
He (Julian) tries to explain to his (Julian) friends--Edith Bartlett and her (Bartlett) family-- why their society is so awful and cruel, and how it can be transformed into something much better
